<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/18/boeings-737-max-cleared-takeoff?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
737 Max Cleared for Takeoff
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="jet contrails" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTY4L2pldF9jb250cmFpbHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twenty months after it was initially grounded, Boeing’s 737 Max has been <a href="https://apnews.com/article/technology-steve-dickson-coronavirus-pandemic-airlines-c7fb5a10cc92354a792fd19d0028cf68?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cleared to fly</a> by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). In a video message, the agency’s administrator Steve Dickson said he’d be “100 percent comfortable with my family flying on it.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The Max had been involved in two fatal crashes—one in Ethiopia and one in Indonesia—that killed 346 people in total. In March 2019, aviation regulators around the world said the jet couldn’t fly again until Boeing and the FAA figured out what went wrong...and fixed it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This story was one of the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-18/boeing-max-cleared-to-fly-as-faa-lifts-longest-u-s-grounding?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most dramatic</a> we’ve followed in the past several years. And it features many superlatives: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Longest grounding of a jet in U.S. history </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>By far the worst crisis in Boeing’s 100+ year history</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Considering the 737 Max was the bestselling plane from the U.S.’ preeminent industrial company, some consider it to be the country’s most important manufacturing product. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The cost has been huge</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/18/business/boeing-737-max-faa.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a> the crisis and its aftermath have cost $20 billion. CEO Dennis Muilenburg was replaced. And despite a steady climb back from pandemic lows, Boeing’s share price sits at less than half of the company’s all-time high on March 1, 2019. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And there’s no calculating the human cost. Some families of the victims have argued the 737 Max should never fly again.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Boeing and its regulator, the FAA, won’t be Googling themselves for a long time. A deep-dive report from a congressional subcommittee blamed the crashes on a “horrific culmination of a series of faulty technical assumptions” by Boeing engineers as well as “grossly insufficient oversight by the FAA.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What next? </strong>Despite a series of software fixes and the lifting of the grounding order, the 737 Max won’t fly immediately—the first flight on its schedule is an American Airlines route from Miami to NYC on Dec. 29. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even then, the company faces a jittery public because of both the plane’s history and the ongoing pandemic. In an <a href="https://twitter.com/search?q=737%20max%20boeing%20morning%20brew&src=typed_query&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unofficial poll</a> on Morning Brew’s Twitter account, 54% of respondents said they wouldn’t fly on a 737 Max.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/18/covid19-states-cities-reimpose-restrictions-curb-infection-rates?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Here We Go Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="mural of a doctor with PPE" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTcwL211cmFsX29mX2FfZG9jdG9yX3dpdGhfcHBlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sergey Nikolaev/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the coronavirus sweeps across the country, states and cities are re-implementing restrictions on businesses and social life to curb infection numbers. Here’s a quick roundup:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">New York City, </strong></span><span>home to the country’s largest public school district, ordered schools to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/18/coronavirus-new-york-city-will-close-schools-for-in-person-learning-mayor-says-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">close</a></span><span> for in-person learning as of this morning, citing a 3% positive test threshold.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ohio </strong></span><span>announced a </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/ohio-covid-curfew-statewide-cases-spike-mike-dewine/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three-week curfew</a></span><span> from 10pm to 5am starting today.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">New Mexicans </strong></span><span>have been told to </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/GovMLG/status/1327344308031156224?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shelter in place</a></span><span> for two weeks because of what Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham called a “life-or-death situation.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">California </strong></span><span>reimposed tight restrictions on </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/17/us/california-covid-cases-increase-new-measures/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">94% of its population</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Washington, Michigan, </strong></span><span>and other states have halted indoor dining. So have cities like Philadelphia.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Iowa </strong></span><span>was among some Republican-led states that did a </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/iowa-gov-kim-reynolds-issues-mask-mandate-after-disparaging-it-n1247972?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">180 on mask mandates</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">New Orleans </strong></span><span>said it </span><span><a href="https://www.nola.com/entertainment_life/mardi_gras/article_e5b0dd08-28dc-11eb-b8b2-939bf975bd79.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wouldn’t host parades</a></span><span> next Mardi Gras season for the first time in 42 years. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>with Thanksgiving approaching, the No. 1 topic of conversation in our group chats is, “Should I go home for the holiday?” Here’s <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/davidmack/coronavirus-thanksgiving-holiday-travel-safety-tips?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some advice from experts</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/18/google-rolls-new-allinone-payments-app?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google, Yesterday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simpsons character saying "You'll pay"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=511 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o6Mbl9dpwlw8mkLsY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simpsons character saying " You'll pay"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o6Mbl9dpwlw8mkLsY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looks like Google overheard one too many college students say, “Jerry put down his card, everyone just Venmo him” after a big night out. The tech giant rolled out a revamped <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/18/21571806/google-pay-relaunch-money-payments-finances-deals-offers-banking-plex?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google Pay app</a> yesterday highlighted by a new peer-to-peer payments system. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s got a bunch of cool features</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An “Explore” tab highlights deals and discounts nearby, while users can connect their bank accounts to the “Insights” section to get a high-level look at their finances.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Not all of these features are actually new, but yesterday marks the first time Google has folded them into a single app.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Is it just a data grab in an app’s clothing? </strong>Google <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/11/18/google-pay-looks-take-apple-pay-being-more-like-venmo/3764826001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says no</a>. “When you pay friends, it stays private just between you," according to a company statement. That means no data will be shared with its ad division unless you explicitly allow it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Google’s app will shine if you opt into its advanced features like allowing it to scan your Gmail inbox or Google Photos account to look for receipts. But if users don’t opt in, it will be tough for Google Pay to stand out in a crowded space that already includes Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, PayPal, Venmo, Square Cash, Shop, and others. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This winter, we’re planning to train hard—but not overtrain—with <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_19_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHOOP</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WHOOP is a <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_19_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sleek, no-nonsense wearable</a> that doesn’t ding or buzz on your wrist the entire day. It blends into your life and is used by pro-athletes, like golfer Nick Watney and NFL quarterback Patrick Mahomes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you don’t have to be a professional athlete to train like one. WHOOP can help you train smarter, no matter what your “gym” looks like. <strong style="color:#000">WHOOP’s Strain Coach lets you monitor your heart rate 24/7 with insight into how strenuous your training and day is to better understand the exertion put on your body.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when we say strain, <a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_19_a_primarybody" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we mean the true measure of how much stress you're putting on your body</a>, both mentally and physically. WHOOP Strain is measured on a scale of 0 to 21 and can be affected by things like work, parenting, anxiety, exercise, and even running errands (aka: the things we do every single day).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Start training better without overtraining. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="http://www.whoop.com?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=whoop2h&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_content=11_19_a_primarycta" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try WHOOP today</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIG TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/18/apple-shrink-app-store-feesfor-certain-developers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Cuts Its Cut
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Apple <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/18/21572302/apple-app-store-small-business-program-commission-cut-15-percent-reduction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that starting Jan. 1, it will lower the bite it takes out of App Store sales from 30% to 15%—but only for small developers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Who counts as small: </strong></span><span>Those that generate $1 million or less in annual revenue (after Apple takes its 15% chunk). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Small is also a good way to describe the difference the move will make in Apple’s ongoing battle with software companies such as Epic Games, Spotify, and Tinder owner Match Group...none of which fit in the “small” category. Epic CEO Tim Sweeney dismissed the announcement.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those bigger players are also the ones that drive the most revenue in the App Store, a major growth engine for Apple’s services division. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The App Store is essential to Apple’s long-term strategy, but it’s also been <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/81f7960e-78f9-41c2-a10a-fdb353bc6b2c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the center</a> of antitrust allegations in both the U.S. and the EU. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ In other news out of virtual Cupertino...</strong>Apple agreed to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/11/18/apple-fine-battery/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay $113 million</a> to settle an investigation into its past practice of slowing down old iPhones to shore up their batteries. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/18/social-media-startup-yubo-unique-business-model?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Youths Are Obsessed With a New App
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Actor saying "Youths" angrily " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=349 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/zOSEurjXCPTag/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Actor saying "Youths" angrily ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/zOSEurjXCPTag/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">French startup Yubo raised an additional <a href="https://sifted.eu/articles/yubo-fundraising/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$47.5 million</a> yesterday to fuel its bid to reimagine social media. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s doing a lot more than just copying Snap stories. The app consists of a variety of “rooms” users can enter to videochat with friends or strangers. Rooms are filtered by location or topic of conversation and are meant to facilitate the type of spontaneous interactions that bubble up at an IRL party. In between chats, users can swipe left or right to add friends, similar to Tinder. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it makes money:</strong> Yubo is completely ad-free. It relies on a “freemium” model that encourages users to buy premium features like boosting your profile on the Swipe page. CEO Sacha Lazimi thinks it’s the future of social media monetization. “If you focus on ads, you’re competing with Facebook, TikTok, and Snap,” <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/11/17/yubo-could-be-the-next-big-social-app-as-it-raises-47-5-million/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he told</a> TechCrunch. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Like Bryson Dechambeau’s golf swing, the unique approach is (mostly) working. Hours spent in live rooms is up 400% from last year, while Yubo’s total users recently topped 40 million. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Life in a bubble: </strong>Tour the most beautiful <a href="https://www.architecturaldigest.com/gallery/most-beautifully-designed-outdoor-dining-experiences-america?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outdoor dining experiences</a> that have popped up across the U.S. this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Work playlists: </strong>Listen to <a href="https://fieldrecordings.xyz/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">field recordings</a> (it’s exactly what it says) or reminisce about crowded lunch spots with <a href="https://coffitivity.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Coffivity</a>. For a laugh, try these soundscape <a href="https://wfhsounds.netlify.app/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">parodies</a> or KFC’s <a href="http://kfchill.co.uk/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sizzling site</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">House tours:</strong> Would you rather live in <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AwhBTrzzqeg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dakota Johnson’s</a> or <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uXYyyhUcFg4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">J Balvin’s</a> house?</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew’s Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re feeling intimidated by all 768 pages of Barack Obama’s new book, <a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781524763169?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>A Promised Land</em></a>, try checking out some other great memoirs instead.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780393357738?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Sounds Like Titanic</em></a></span><span> is Jessica Chiccehitto Hindman’s story of touring the world as a fake concert violinist. Beneath her too-crazy-to-believe tale is insightful commentary on gender, the economy, and our love of what is fake. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781524759216?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Eat a Peach</em></a></span><span> shows how David Chang, the culinary icon behind Momofuku, carved a rollercoaster path through the restaurant industry. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780062291707?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Daring: My Passages</em></a></span><span> is the late Gail Sheehy’s recounting of an extraordinary life as a journalist covering major cultural shifts and some of the biggest leaders of the 20th century. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Find more memoirs and other book recommendations on our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf homepage</a>. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How good are you at separating fact from fiction? Three of these headlines are real while one is made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"French radio </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexledsom/2020/11/18/french-radio-accidentally-announces-death-of-100-of-worlds-most-famous-people/?sh=56d0053725e8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accidentally announces</a></span><span> death of 100 of world’s most famous people"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Man tries to sue Peloton for </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/wg4y5TWOFXN3a/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">failing to disclose</a></span><span> that its exercise bikes are not roadworthy"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Dolly Parton </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2020/nov/17/dolly-parton-partly-funded-moderna-covid-vaccine-research?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partly funded</a></span><span> Moderna Covid vaccine research"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Turkmenistan's authoritarian leader unveils </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/13/asia/turkmenistan-dog-statue-intl-hnk-scli/index.html#:~:text=Turkmenistan's%20authoritarian%20leader%20unveils%20huge%20golden%20dog%20statue%20in%20the%20capital,-By%20Helen%20Regan&text=A%20statue%20of%20a%20Turkmen,circle%20in%20the%20capital%20Ashgabat.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge golden dog statue</a></span><span> in the capital"</span>
</li>
</ol>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTY4L2pldF9jb250cmFpbHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwenty months after it was initially grounded, Boeing’s 737 Max has been \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/technology-steve-dickson-coronavirus-pandemic-airlines-c7fb5a10cc92354a792fd19d0028cf68?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecleared to fly\u003c/a\u003e by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). In a video message, the agency’s administrator Steve Dickson said he’d be “100 percent comfortable with my family flying on it.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Max had been involved in two fatal crashes—one in Ethiopia and one in Indonesia—that killed 346 people in total. In March 2019, aviation regulators around the world said the jet couldn’t fly again until Boeing and the FAA figured out what went wrong...and fixed it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis story was one of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-18/boeing-max-cleared-to-fly-as-faa-lifts-longest-u-s-grounding?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost dramatic\u003c/a\u003e we’ve followed in the past several years. And it features many superlatives: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLongest grounding of a jet in U.S. history \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBy far the worst crisis in Boeing’s 100+ year history\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsidering the 737 Max was the bestselling plane from the U.S.’ preeminent industrial company, some consider it to be the country’s most important manufacturing product. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe cost has been huge\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/18/business/boeing-737-max-faa.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimates\u003c/a\u003e the crisis and its aftermath have cost $20 billion. CEO Dennis Muilenburg was replaced. And despite a steady climb back from pandemic lows, Boeing’s share price sits at less than half of the company’s all-time high on March 1, 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd there’s no calculating the human cost. Some families of the victims have argued the 737 Max should never fly again.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBoeing and its regulator, the FAA, won’t be Googling themselves for a long time. A deep-dive report from a congressional subcommittee blamed the crashes on a “horrific culmination of a series of faulty technical assumptions” by Boeing engineers as well as “grossly insufficient oversight by the FAA.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat next? \u003c/strong\u003eDespite a series of software fixes and the lifting of the grounding order, the 737 Max won’t fly immediately—the first flight on its schedule is an American Airlines route from Miami to NYC on Dec. 29. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven then, the company faces a jittery public because of both the plane’s history and the ongoing pandemic. In an \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/search?q=737%20max%20boeing%20morning%20brew\u0026src=typed_query\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunofficial poll\u003c/a\u003e on Morning Brew’s Twitter account, 54% of respondents said they wouldn’t fly on a 737 Max.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooks like Google overheard one too many college students say, “Jerry put down his card, everyone just Venmo him” after a big night out. The tech giant rolled out a revamped \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/18/21571806/google-pay-relaunch-money-payments-finances-deals-offers-banking-plex?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGoogle Pay app\u003c/a\u003e yesterday highlighted by a new peer-to-peer payments system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s got a bunch of cool features\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn “Explore” tab highlights deals and discounts nearby, while users can connect their bank accounts to the “Insights” section to get a high-level look at their finances.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNot all of these features are actually new, but yesterday marks the first time Google has folded them into a single app.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIs it just a data grab in an app’s clothing? \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2020/11/18/google-pay-looks-take-apple-pay-being-more-like-venmo/3764826001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays no\u003c/a\u003e. “When you pay friends, it stays private just between you,\" according to a company statement. That means no data will be shared with its ad division unless you explicitly allow it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle’s app will shine if you opt into its advanced features like allowing it to scan your Gmail inbox or Google Photos account to look for receipts. But if users don’t opt in, it will be tough for Google Pay to stand out in a crowded space that already includes Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, PayPal, Venmo, Square Cash, Shop, and style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Apple \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/11/18/21572302/apple-app-store-small-business-program-commission-cut-15-percent-reduction?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" to 15%—but only for small developers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho counts as small: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose that generate $1 million or less in annual revenue (after Apple takes its 15% chunk). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Small is also a good way to describe the difference the move will make in Apple’s ongoing battle with software companies such as Epic Games, Spotify, and Tinder owner Match Group...none of which fit in the “small” category. Epic CEO Tim Sweeney dismissed the announcement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose bigger players are also the ones that drive the most revenue in the App Store, a major growth engine for Apple’s services division. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe App Store is essential to Apple’s long-term strategy, but it’s also been \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/81f7960e-78f9-41c2-a10a-fdb353bc6b2c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe center\u003c/a\u003e of antitrust allegations in both the U.S. and the EU. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ In other news out of virtual width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrench startup Yubo raised an additional \u003ca href=\"https://sifted.eu/articles/yubo-fundraising/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$47.5 million\u003c/a\u003e yesterday to fuel its bid to reimagine social media. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s doing a lot more than just copying Snap stories. The app consists of a variety of “rooms” users can enter to videochat with friends or strangers. Rooms are filtered by location or topic of conversation and are meant to facilitate the type of spontaneous interactions that bubble up at an IRL party. In between chats, users can swipe left or right to add friends, similar to Tinder. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it makes money:\u003c/strong\u003e Yubo is completely ad-free. It relies on a “freemium” model that encourages users to buy premium features like boosting your profile on the Swipe page. CEO Sacha Lazimi thinks it’s the future of social media monetization. “If you focus on ads, you’re competing with Facebook, TikTok, and Snap,” \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/11/17/yubo-could-be-the-next-big-social-app-as-it-raises-47-5-million/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe told\u003c/a\u003e TechCrunch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eLike Bryson Dechambeau’s golf swing, the unique approach is (mostly) working. Hours spent in live rooms is up 400% from last year, while Yubo’s total users recently topped 40 million. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
